alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:19PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sheridan County through 800 PM MDT... At 718 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sheridan, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding and ponding of water on roadways, including Interstate 90. Locations impacted include... Sheridan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
